messages.title: STRONG AND STABLE FUTURE
messages.content: Neil Carmichael believes a strong and stable economy is the best way to meet rising pressures of the cost of living and ensure good schools and hospitals for Stroud Valleys and Vale.

messages.title: CHAMPIONING OUR CHILDREN'S MENTAL HEALTH
messages.content: Neil has welcomed the Prime Minister's manifesto commitment that a new Conservative Government would reform Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, helping to provide better mental health care to more children in Stroud Valleys and Vale.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Neil supports the reform of Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services as outlined by the Prime Minister to provide better care for children's mental health.
Neil acknowledges the importance of the UK's universities to remain open and accessible to students and academics from across the EU, ensuring they can continue to contribute to their communities.

mentions.candidate: Neil has been actively fighting for local issues and has successfully campaigned for local schools to receive over Â£6,000,000 of additional funding, etc.
mentions.partyLeader: The leaflet features a picture of Neil Carmichael with the then Prime Minister, Theresa May, indicating support from the party leader.

issues.brexitEurope: The importance of universities to remain accessible post-Brexit.
issues.economy: A strong and stable economy is essential for supporting the cost of living, and good schools and hospitals in the area.
issues.education: Successful campaign for additional funding for local schools.
issues.environment: Protecting our natural environment as shown by a photo description.
issues.health: Reform of Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services.

leaflet.personalStatement: A strong leader for Britain. A strong voice for Stroud Valleys and Vale.

images.caption: Neil Carmichael with the Prime Minister, Theresa May.
